<small>Aramaic form: [[H6992]]</small>
 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קָטַל‎</span>] **verb** ==slay== (in poetry and late) (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קתל‎</span> [[BDB#Hom|Hom]]<sup>Chrest.126</sup>, all ***slay*** (original form with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ת‎</span>; changed later, after <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ק‎</span>); Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קְטַל‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Old Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קטל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כטל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קתל‎</span>); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** with accusative of person, 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִקְטָלֿ‎</span> [[Job.24.14|Job 24:14]] suffix, subject God, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִקְטְלֵנִי‎</span> [[Job.13.15|Job 13:15]] of God also 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּקְטֹל‎</span> [[Ps.139.19|Ps 139:19]].
